meta.description: Qatar Airways Al Mourjan Business Class Lounge at Hamad International Airport (DOH), Terminal 1. Learn more about the lounge: amenities, photos, review, opening hours, location.

lounge.name: Qatar Airways Al Mourjan Business Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: From the Duty Free South Area, go up the escalators located to the left of the Giant Teddy Bear near Eye-Q Sunglasses and the Seafood Bar Caviar House & Prunier.

lounge.description: Offering a luxurious experience rivaling any five-star boutique hotel, this exclusive oasis redefines the world standard in airport lounge experiences. Enter and treat your five senses to a beautiful portrayal of Arabian heritage in a refreshing resort-like atmosphere. Savor tantalizing a la carte and buffet dining options, and take in Qatar Airways' signature brand of hospitality.

reviews.content: Exquisite taste and class in this lounge. Spacious yet cozy with multiple areas for dining, quiet rooms, lounging. Staff was top class! Love it all. Shukraan Doha, I’ll be back after this pandemic!
Everything you would expect from a proper business class lounge and more, free flowing champagne.
This is probably the best lounge I’ve ever visited. Expansive, comfortable, beautifully decorated with great food and drink - it’s almost a destination in and of itself.
One of the most gorgeous lounges in the world.  Great food selection, HUGE space and never feels too busy.
Really stylish lounge. The restaurant and bar options are pretty good. However, I felt it was somewhat uncomfortable for long transits, as it is crowded and the seats were not really comfortable.
One of the best lounges I've ever been to. Lovely design. Apparently they've reduced food options of late but still great. Nap rooms, showers. No apron views. Empty here midday
Very impressive lounge with good showers and areas to nap. Food selection was OK. Slightly impersonal feel given the size of the lounge.
Quiet rooms with sofas and more shower rooms past the downstairs restaurant. Breakfast options include Western, East Asian, Indian, and Arabic choices. Staff is wonderful and hard working.
A triumph of style over substance, dining great but trying to find a comfortable seat is nigh on impossible. Hopelessly crowded and hour long waits to have a shower. Sorry, not impressed.
One of the world's great airline lounges. Only downside might be even with its vast size it can get crowded during hub peaks.
One of the most impressive business lounges in the world. Amazingly designed with all of the food and drink you can possibly think of. 3 hours was not enough time!
The lounge is a grandiose experience with lots of bling-blings. The lounge is massive without making it too airy as they do a great job in separating spaces in between. The work area is great.
Much nicer than the “first class” lounge. Food pretty good but could be better.
It's sad to see how this lounge has gotten worse over the years. It's still quite stunning, but it's over crowded. Broken coffee machines, crowded toilets, showers not available, no mugs or glasses.

Lovely huge lounge with many amenities and facilities for a restful layover. Brilliant design and excellent experience. Definitely worth a revisit when in this airport the next time I fly here to Doha.
Really a spectacularly beautiful lounge. Arrived in transit at the peak hours, 11pm to 2am and did get a shower. Absolutely outstanding customer service and friendliness by all.
Huge but a bit cold - don’t bother w/ cafe side - go to the restaurant part -excellent service but no spa except for first class.
Beautifully designed lounge. Not crowded. Great facilities. Really clean and well maintained. Good selection of food items and beverages. Very helpful staff. Free medium-speed wifi.
I was astonished at the negative reviews I have read after spending an evening in the business class lounge. It is the biggest most beautiful and spectacular lounges. There are three restaurants.
THIS lounge is awesome, well worth the 120 USD I was quoted as companion to business class.
Outstanding lounge with many seating areas for different purposes. Has nap rooms and showers as well as several restaurants. Good selection of drinks and food, including also à la carte options.
Absolutely superb lounge. Only critique as there are clearly not enough showers as wait times averaged 30-45 minutes both times I was there.
The times of Krug Champagne and Beef Fillet are over! Billecart-Salmon and a self service buffet instead. I'm a bit disappointed - especially the buffet is average. In summary nevertheless 4 stars!
Great lounge! One of the best in the world.
Very impressive area and plenty of options. Showers were full so couldn't have one.
Biggest lounge I've been in. A la carte dining downstairs a little difficult to find. Buffet upstairs. Outstanding food and beverages.
I agree with the "resort-like" moniker. Thoughtfully designed spaces make the lounge's size an asset. To fault anything in this lounge would just be trying to find something to complain about.
Very good overall. But signage and food quality is average. Quiet area only have sofa but not have bed to rest.
Excellent lounge. It has everything! Snack bar with fresh sandwiches, a dining room, business center, quiet room, showers, and even a prayer room. You can spend a day in the lounge and not get bored.
It is too big, it feels more like an terminal.
*Updated* Very difficult to fault. Plenty space, great bar, restaurant(s) and service excellent. Long waits for shower sadly and a bit annoying. Food/drink choice is fantastic. Highly recommend.
Quiet respite. Service varies average-extraordinary. Shower suites lovely (but HOT). Good variety of comfortable seating. Nice valet service to store luggage. Good snack bars. Restaurants 7/10.
Overall a fantastic lounge, but was a bit bummed that they do not serve alcohol at all during Ramadan. Seems they have also stopped table service at the restaurant, etc. Food good, but not amazing.
The wifi's slow but the food and the service are excellent. Showers are poorly signposted. There are some on the opposite side to the entrance but you find more at the far end, in the quiet area.
Been there twice, lacks a good quiet and comfortable rest area. Too noisy between 8 PM and 2 AM due to excessive room. It may have been better to have 3 lounges 1/3 the size of this each.
Gold standard... Unless you're in F, that is.

Baller lounge. 1 monstrous space. Tons of seating but also pretty full. Nice design. Fast airport wifi. Good made to order food. Clean restrooms & showers. Lots of different seating types. Middle of terminal.
This lounge is vast. It can be hard to get your bearings inside. There are numerous different seating options and a good staffed restaurant and bar. It feels a little sterile inside though.
Fantastic lounge, spacious and beautiful. The food, both to order and buffet, was very good - and the drinks are outstanding!
Another outstanding QR lounge, more crowded than Al Safwa First of course. Tons of quiet seating areas, two full-service eateries, biz center, game room, showers. It really lacks nothing.

A nice and big lounge, you'll sure find a spot to relax. The table service upstairs was rather slow, people complained. I kept it to some Krug and the buffet.
Staff is very friendly nonetheless
Huge and luxurious lounge, excellent wine selection and freshly made food. Absolutely top notch.
The epitome of a premium lounge. Puts all other lounges to shame.
By far the best lounge worldwide..tremendous..huge..
Expansive. Well appointed. Quirky. Staff everywhere so service is fast. Many different areas to relax, including a "dining resort". Similar in feel to the famous LH FCL. Secret showers in quiet area.
Impressive but not cosy, a pretty stark environment of steel and glass. Skip table service upstairs and go for a great pastrami sandwich in the friendly downstairs cafe. Why no milk for my tea guys?
Great atmosphere and the facility is superb but the staff in dining room are disappointing.
You will find everything and anything that you could possibly need while waiting for your next flight. And QR delivers in style - great design, good à la carte food and top notch service.
Wonderful, crazy lounge 😱 What a lounge ..
Impressive layout and design elements. Multiple seating areas for relaxation or work. Buffet dining upstairs, a la carte restaurant downstairs.
Anyone who finds fault with this place is a nit picking nutter. Huge. Service fantastic. Make sure to explore ALL the areas if you have time.
Fantastic lounge, really big and excellent service and food. A lot of rooms and many seats to relax.
Excellent lounge. I was able to get in with oneworld emerald status and economy seats.
Love it, only miss sleeping area.
Wow Wow wow! Its soooo gr8!!!!

Huge lounge, crowded at times, losing all exclusivity, but good food, drink and seating 'zones'. Bit like a massive hotel lobby, still a little over hyped - very good lounge but not best in the world.
Great huge two level areas with 12 zones. 24 hours running.

location.terminalDirections: Ground Floor, Arrivals Level, After Baggage Reclaim
Ground Floor, Arrivals Level, Before Immigration
South Node Level 2. From the Teddy Bear Area, walk straight. Take the elevator or lift on the left. The lounge is located near Gates A, B and C.
Level M, Central Zone North Node. Walk or take the train to North Node, Concourse C. Located next to the Al Mourjan Orchard Business Class Lounge.
In the Duty Free South Area, take the escalators located to the northeast of the Giant Teddy Bear.

otherLounges.name: Qatar Airways Al Mourjan Business Class Lounge - North
Qatar Airways Al Mourjan Orchard Business Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Level M, Central Zone North Node. Walk or take the train to North Node, Concourse C. Access the lounge via escalators to the right, located before the Oryx Garden Hotel.

otherLounges.name: Qatar Airways Al Safwa First Class Lounge

location.terminalDirections: From the Duty Free South Area, go up the escalators located to the right of the Giant Teddy Bear near IN-Q Cafe and Cedar Room Cigars.

otherLounges.name: Qatar Airways First and Business Class Arrivals Lounge

location.terminalDirections: Ground Floor, Arrivals Level, after Baggage Reclaim.

otherLounges.name: Qatar Airways First and Business Class Arrivals Lounge (Before Immigration)

location.terminalDirections: Ground Floor, Arrivals Level, before Immigration.
Located in Concourse A, Level 1, Duty Free Plaza South.

otherLounges.name: Sleep n' Fly Sleep Lounge (South Node)

location.terminalDirections: Located in the luxury Duty Free area, near B Gates, 2 minutes walk from the iconic Teddy Bear sculpture, inside the corridor next to Loro Piana. The sleep 'n fly Sleep Lounge is centrally located in the heart of the transit area and in easy reach from passport control and all flight gates.

otherLounges.name: Sleep n' Fly Sleep Lounge & Showers (North Node)

location.terminalDirections: Located opposite Gates C30-31 on the lower level.
